channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Is Russia looking to disrupt Elon Musk's Starlink constellation?
After Osman Hadi, another leader shot. How Bangladesh violence continues to spiral out of control
Can Delhi’s toxic air make menstrual cramps more painful?
India-New Zealand FTA: Why this trade deal is a win-win for both countries
Gold hits record high of $4,400 per ounce. What’s pushing the price of yellow metal up?
Who is Faisal Karim Masud, the main suspect in the killing of Bangladesh’s Osman Hadi?
Pakistan seems to be falling into Gaza trap: Risking public wrath for Trump’s plan
item.description: The ‘no free lunch’ dilemma highlights domestic risks for Gen Asim Munir: saying yes to Washington’s demands to send troops to Gaza could spark backlash from Islamist parties and destabilise Pakistan, while saying no could strain relations with the US

item.title: Bondi Beach attack signals alarming resurgence of Islamic State
item.description: ISIS may have resorted to enhancing online propaganda and carrying out inspired attacks without direct involvement

item.title: How India’s latest visa reforms are a pragmatic step
item.description: Amid US-China trade wars, India's decision to streamline visa rules for Chinese professionals is a lifeline for economic ambition

item.title: Why Washington’s ‘With Us or Against Us’ doctrine no longer works on New Delhi
item.description: India is an ally of the West, arguably the most important long-term partner in countering Chinese hegemony in the Indo-Pacific, but it seeks equitable partnership, not hierarchical subservience

item.title: Beyond pyramids: Cairo is more than the land of Pharaohs
item.description: From restored Old Cairo to the newly expanded New Cairo, this Egyptian capital is undergoing a sweeping cultural and urban revival

item.title: 2026 outlook: India set to rise amid a turbulent world
item.description: As 2026 approaches, India is expected to continue balancing its interests amid global power competition, seeking strategic partnerships while maintaining strategic autonomy, positioning itself as a major economic and strategic power in a turbulent world
